title: Commands delay?
body:
Sometimes my game play is completely fine but at random times the frame rate seems to drop... Like say I command my champion to go into the grass, delayed for like a sec before it enters there. Don't think my internet got problems, its 25 ms. At first I thought my mouse right button just having problems but doesn't seem like the issues since I don't have that problem in other things outside of League while my skillshots also delayed before firing it. Not sure what's the real problem here... my fps also seems fine. Got any idea what causes these command delays? Hope you get the idea on what I'm talking about.  Any support is appreciate.

EDIT: Ok, I found out that it is pocket loss issue. I fix this issue before simply by stop using wireless and just go with Ethernet. This time... I don't know how to fix it. My old way doesn't work anymore. The logs that got problems is "2016-04-05T00-04-23_netlog"(Not sure if that was useful). The rest is fine.

replies.body:
*Packet Loss* can certainly cause the delays you're seeing in-game. Before we take a look at your network routing to check for problematic hops along the way, we first need to confirm your local network settings are good. I recommend going through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to configure your network for League.

If you still see these symptoms after taking those networking steps, please let me know so we can investigate further.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=MR7FH0n4,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-01-09T00:52:53.952+0000)
>
> *Packet Loss* can certainly cause the delays you're seeing in-game. Before we take a look at your network routing to check for problematic hops along the way, we first need to confirm your local network settings are good. I recommend going through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to configure your network for League.
> 
> If you still see these symptoms after taking those networking steps, please let me know so we can investigate further.

I've read the whole thing and I disconnected my cables and all before going to bed. My internet is disconnected for a whole night and the problem isn't solved. I reinstall and the problem is still there. The guide isn't helping. I've read them all.
I'm glad you read all the steps, but did you try all the suggestions inside the guide as troubleshooting steps? Once you've confirmed that you have, we can take a look at your network routing.

Ok, what I discover is that the frame rate doesn't fall at all. If I view my teammates or my enemies, their champion is functioning properly like no random lag spike and all. My problem is the delays on my autos and my movements which I don't understand.
